taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe heliantheae;subtribe pectidinae;genus pectis;species papposa;variety grandis

bio:treatment.description: Plants 5–30 cm. Leaves 20–60 mm. Peduncles 10–40 mm. Phyllaries 5–8 mm. Ray corollas 5–8 mm. Disc florets 12–24(–34); corollas 3–5 mm. Cypselae 3–5.5 mm; disc pappi 2.5–4 mm. 2n = 24.
Deserts, desert grasslands, dry woodlands, roadsides;
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety grandis is restricted for the most part to the Chihuahuan Desert with outlying populations in central Arizona. It often grows with Pectis angustifolia var. angustifolia in trans-Pecos Texas, especially on roadsides; occasional hybrids have been noted.
